alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 1:06AM CDT until June 17 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Baldwin. In northwest Florida, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 415 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 104 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall over the advisory area. Many locations remain saturated from recent heavy to extreme rainfall, so these storms could quickly produce localized flooding of urban and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Brent, West Pensacola, Warrington, Fairhope, Foley, Orange Beach, Goulding, Robertsdale, Point Clear, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Summerdale, Silverhill, Perdido Beach, Elberta, Pensacola Beach and Fort Morgan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
